name: Hotel Atlantico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was travelling for working purposes in Juli/August, low season for Madrid, and therefore was able to take advantage of a good internet rate. (I still wonder how the high normal rate can be afforded by normal people).
reviews.title: Good Hotel if you get the right room

likes.disliked: — My small and dark room; slow Internet connection, musak in top flor bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers that the location is perfect. Just aross the street from Metro Callao, you’ll get anywhere in town in a snap (I recommend the metro & bus "flatrate" tickets for cheap and unlimited travelling on all metro and bus lines in the city).
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a mixed bag: Staff is friendly and helpful, everything spotlessly clean, the view from the rooftop terrace was gorgeous. My room, though, was small and dark, like all the rooms not facing outwards, so make sure you get one facing Gran Via!
reviews.title: tale of two cities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well. for THAT room I would give no more than three stars, grudgingly. The view and location are five stars, definetely.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

likes.liked: — Large Room, modern, clean. Roof terrace.
likes.disliked: — Poor natural light on inside room, but wasn't really a problem for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Internet connection, though present, is awfully slow - I needed it urgently to upload work related data and finally had to go an Internet café outside (Staff agreed that something has to be done about that since they suffer themselves from the inconvenience).
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, beautiful rooms

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious, luxurious rooms, lovely bathrobes, nice breakfast, fab rooftop patio area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Olive (my wife) and self had a most pleasant stay at Best Western Atlantico. The staff were so kind and helpful to us (Ruth, Carmelo, Alfonsos and the lady who managed the 9th floor facilities). Our bedroom was excellent - as was the breakfast each morning. As other reviewers have mentioned the locationn of the Best Western Atlantico could not be better. A genuine thank you to all the staff each of whom made our stay a pleasure. The Best Western Hotel Atlantico, in our opinion deserves, at the very least, a four star grading. Edmund C, Co Dublin, Ireland.
reviews.title: perfect in every detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very Good Hotel. In a great location with great staff. The roof top bar is beautiful with great views of the city, and the rooms are very big and well decorated. Would definitely stay there again on my next trip to Madrid.
reviews.title: Excellent - everything you need is here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Madrid for 4 days in August 2007, I had no idea where to stay as I do not really know the city so I had a look at trip advisor and found excellent reviews on this hotel and I have to say, it is truly a great hotel.
reviews.title: A true gem in the heart of Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It could not be more perfectly located in Madrid, in the heart of Gran Via, allowing people who stay there to access all major attraction and monuments very easily.
reviews.title: Best Western Atlantico: great hotel to stay!
Exceptional hotel, location and staff
reviews.text: The rooms are very big and the bathroom is amazing for such a cheap price (it costed 70 EUR a night only!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in Madrid. The hotel itself is in excellent condition and our room was clean and very comfortable. You could easily walk to all the sights from this location, which made it convenient. The breakfast was top notch as was the lovely rooftop bar. The hotel staff were nice, but were not at all helpful in recommending restaurants. The downside of the hotel is that it is on a very noisy street and there are many very aggressive vagrants who lurk around the hotel, not to mention hookers who work the area in the evening.
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Noisy Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is more than I expected form a 3 star hotel, ok maybe a higger price than most, but totally worth it.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was really helpfull, the room was big, with a massive and elegant bathroom and lovely bathrobes.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
Good location, decent hotel for the price
reviews.text: Fairly big tv in the room, and even the possibility to use the tv as a computer to go on-line with a keyboard provided

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My only complain, my window looked over a wall... but other than that a great hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful !!
After a very enjoyable 4 night stay we...
reviews.text: After a very enjoyable 4 night stay we were stranded by the volcano ash incident and the staff at BW Atlantico couldn't have been more helpful at such a stressful time. They made sure we had a room each night and even gave us a discounted rate, when most businesses were busy exploiting the situation. Wonderful reception staff, lovely rooftop terrace bar with free tea and coffee and free wifi everywhere, all at excellent value for such a central location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent one week stay at this hotel; the hotel is perfectly situated close to the Puerta del Sol+ Plaza Mayor. Also a few meters away from the Mayor metro station. Staff assistance was excellent & they can all communicate effectively in English ....... unlike many Spaniards. We were fortunate to have our request granted for a room overlooking the Gran Via and on the upper floors. Room was spacious and not at all noisy. We opted to have breakfast at hotel (not included in our pre-booking) and this too was to our liking. I will strongly recommend this hotel to all Madrid visitors.
reviews.title: Perfect location + Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the reviews on here about the excellence of the hotel, its location, good service and friendly staff, are spot-on. We had a great time staying here.
reviews.title: Excellent service in a time of need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: But that's not why I'm leaving this review (first ever!). Its when things go wrong you find out how good a service provider is, and things went wrong for us when we (like others) were stranded at the end of the holiday due to the icelandic volcano airspace closures.
reviews.title: Not so soundproofed after all !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As another reviewer said, the staff were truly excellent. Even though they were fully booked, they were adament that all stranded guests would either stay at the hotel, or they would find them somewhere else to stay (we stayed for another two comfortable nights). They were on the internet for me looking for flights and other information - I know they assisted many other guests too.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: Booked this on the back of the reviews for a business trip - was great value as was about £60 a night, the room was a little small but had everything i needed - internet etc.. Lovely roof top bar with great views over Madrid - get up into the top room in the dome - the views get even better. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a handy room in a great city!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Location - small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights during the hottest month of the year. The hotel is very clean and with the air conditioning the stay was very pleasant. Our bed is comfortable and the bathroom is of good standard. During daytime, the big Gran Via street is safe and crowded. However, at night many prosititutes stand along the street and can be a littlte bit dangerous. Some side streets near the hotel are very dirty. Try to avoid walking alone on those streets at night.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, tricky area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: The hotel has a great location. Accessible to everything and safe. We were given an updgraded double room......2 twin beds put together, though we requested 1 king/queen bed. The floor had a stale smell, but the room was good. The receptionist told us that this was a new floor and all new rooms. Not sure how the older floors would have smelt.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall clean and good stay, though if not upgraded, I am not sure how our stay would have been. The hotel staff was hit miss.
reviews.title: Great value at Hotel Atlantico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In spite of the inauspicious entrance and very small lobby, this is an excellent value hotel in the heart of Madrid. The room was spotlessly clean and included a large walk-in closet. Even though the windows opened onto the center shaft, we did not spend much time there, and the room was large. The included breakfast was adequate, but lacked sufficient fresh fruits. The younger staff tried to be helpful and had a good customer-service attitude; the older staff members could be a bit surly. As other reviewers have said, the roof top bar is spectacular, especially when there is a clear sky and the ascending moon. We went there every evening and enjoyed the solitude above the bustling street and the vast vistas. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: As the plane touched the tarmac we could not fail to be impressed with Norman Foster's airport masterpiece at the new Madrid airport.
reviews.title: Brilliant location

likes.liked: — location, the breakfasts elegance of the decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On leaving the airport just outside the terminal exit,our hearts leapt as we spied a Best Western Hotel's minibus,do not hang around here unless you have pre booked it ,(as we learnt, )because the driver is not going to turn up from the blue.Even ringing the hotel did not come to an fruitful conclusion,as they said he should arrive at 2.30 nobody appeared,then yes he should arrive at 3.30pm definately- nothing!!!!.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: We got a metro in the end after getting a free transport to the old airport with about 3 changes up and down steps(not advisable with heavy luggage).The staff at the hotel Atlantico on the Gran Via were not very empathetic about our experience, because it looked as if a separate company run the transport system and it wasn't their concern.,although on pointing to a board in the lobby,it was best to purchase the return tickets the day before,which we did,it was 6 euros well spent on a 25 minute ride which was great and saved lots of steps in the metro and luggging of luggage.Whilst the journey to the hotel took an hour and a half!!!!!
reviews.title: Hotel Atlantico I love you!

likes.disliked: — The pillows could have been better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was very nice, recently refurbished, we had a triple room which was very spacious with bathrobes, slippers, T.V and safe.The maid turned down your bed in the evening,adorning the pillow with an elegant chocolate.If I am to be picky I found the bed to be abit hard with little or no spring.,this could be improved.
reviews.title: It is perfect
Everything you should expect from a 3 star hotel
reviews.text: It was really worth having breakfast which was lovely cereals,cheese, scrambled eggs,sausage, danish pastries,rolls, fruit yogurts and fruit juice,cold meats set you up for the day,not to mention tea and coffee.All in all we enjoyed staying at the Atlantico,the location was brilliant,just across the road from the metro ,bus and tourist information.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location on the Gran Via, within walking distance to everything you will want to see in Madrid. When we checked in the receptionist seemed to be a little more interested in chatting to his friend than sorting out our room, but we got there eventually and he was very polite.
reviews.title: Great Location, but an average 3 star!

likes.disliked: — Noise from other people in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was ok, decor was quirky to say the least, but it was clean and fairly comfy! However the walls are thin and unfortunately the lady in the room next to us was very noisy and talked on the phone throughout the night. Apart from that we had a good stay. We booked the hotel shuttle back to the airport and the staff were very helpful and the shuttle good value - well worth doing that!
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a good, clean hotel in a central location, good value for money ... as always you get what you pay for!
reviews.title: Great Value and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. Excellent location, friendly staff. Our room was at the front of the hotel and the Gran Via noise was never a problem. Room was very spacious, bathroom was excellent, we really couldn't ask for anything more. Definitely worth staying here.
reviews.title: A find in Madrid

likes.liked: — Deluxe rooms offered a perfect layout
likes.disliked: — Singles rooms were a bit small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: All that had been said in previous reviews was on the button. Great location, value for money, helpful staff, great views from terrace.
reviews.title: a gem in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all the great reviews of this hotel, I didn't think it could meet our expectations, but it did. The reviews are all true. The hotel is lovely and the rooftop bar is wonderful for a drink at the end of the day. We had requested a quiet room at the back of the hotel and we were accomodated. There was no view - but also no noise! It was perfect because we want to get a good nights sleep after sight seeing all day. The modern bathroom was large and the two sinks were a bonus. The hotel is spotlessly clean. A wonderful hotel in a great location!
reviews.title: Loved the Atlantico!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a weeklong stay in Madrid we wanted a centralized location with access to the top city sites at reasonable rates. The reviews here on TripAdvisor have been great for this Best Western Hotel, so we gave it a try. I'm very pleased we selected this place. We had an excellent stay.
reviews.title: Perfectly aligned with expectations, then exceeded them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived the room was decorated more nicely than I had worried and the size was a bit small but we figured it would do. Turned out the room was always immaculately clean upon our return from wandering the city. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is good, but you can find better food, cheaper a two-minute walk away on Calle de Jacometrezo or down Gran Via at the Nebraska. It will suit for a first lazy day breakfast when jet-lagged.
reviews.title: Excellent Value Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The view from the room was excellent with a retractable shutter to reduce street sounds that opened to a tiny balcony. All the amenities worked, though the refrigerator was a bit small and contained a message forbidding use for anything but Hotel-provided goods. We promptly ignored that.
reviews.title: Great city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010
reviews.text: The rooftop deck was nice, though some repairs to the building next door made it a dubious place to spend time. The club on the top floor was helpful in many ways. A large TV, a decent bar, a couple computers with internet access. Rooms throughout have wireless access.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay At Hotel Atlantico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: I had a wonderful stay at the Best Western Atlantico this past October.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005
reviews.text: The location is excellent and the service was friendly and very welcoming.
reviews.title: Excellent location, small room
I'd stay there again, Hotel Atlantico
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone who wants a quality hotel for the right price.

reviews.title: Great place
reviews.text: Styaed there in November. Excellent location, just minutes walk from the chueca area and the metro stations. Breakfast was great. Good selection, fresh food and friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005
reviews.text: The only issue I had was that I booked a double bed, and the room was so small the double bed was pushed up against the wall which meant that I had to sleep facing the wall.
reviews.title: Atlantico Was Great
Great Location, Crap Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in the Hotel Atlantico for 2 nights in Feb 2006.

reviews.title: loved the place
reviews.text: Before we arrived I had spent numerous attempts to try and guarantee a double bed in our room which the staff refused to do. As it happens when we arrived we did have a double bed. The room itself was very small and dark and our view non existent(brick wall). The rooms are soundproofed so you cannot hear any of the outside traffic - which is quite substantial! However, you can hear everything going on inside the hotel. Hot water was also a problem, we only had hot water first thing in the morning and only cold water in the evening!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005
reviews.text: If you want to stay somewhere in Madrid thats very well located and you don't mind living without your creature comforts, I would recommend this hotel. Otherwise choose somewhere else to stay.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent seven nights at this hotel (from December 29th to January 5th) and had a great time. It is so centrally located that we never used the metro, buses or taxis to move around. We are city people and enjoyed our corner room (208) on the second floor, which had two balconies (one on the Gran Via and the other on the side street). The room and bathroom were very spacious, nicely furnished and very clean. There was a lot of storage space, the bed was big and comfortable and the lighting was excellent. We were not bothered by the Gran Via’s noise, because when the windows were closed the room was almost soundproofed.
reviews.title: Very, very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast (included in the rate) was OK with a lot of cold and warm options. The receptionists (especially Oscar and Ruth) were professional, friendly, polite and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Atlantico stated we didn't have a reservation but charged for not cancelling!

likes.disliked: — Charging for a reservation they said didn't exist in their records. Hard to accept.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all this is a great hotel, we can recommend it and would not hesitate to return.
reviews.title: Not nearly as good as I was lead to believe here. 4 good nights, 1 awful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Prior to our trip in September 2007, I was calling ahead to confirm my familys reservation and was advised by the reservation desk at Hotel Atlantico that I didn't have a reservation on record nor did they have my name anywhere in their records. As a result, I ended up scrambling to locate other accomodations with only a little more than a week before our scheduled arrival in Madrid.
reviews.title: best hotel in madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007
reviews.text: We had used the Hotel Atlantico web site when making our reservation, so it was an overall dissappointing situation being placed in this difficult situation.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience--Ever

likes.disliked: — Everything was superior...not one thing to complain about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from this wonderful and perfectly located Hotel in Madrid. The Hotel is super clean and safe. The room is spacious and so are the bathrooms all in marble! The staff is the best. Coffe is available 24 hours. Food is good and inexpensive. The bar is great with great view of La Gran Via. Walking distance to Sun Gate, Callao Square, Plaza Espana, Plaza Mayor and Royal Palace. This was my second stay at this hotel. They offer complimentary transfers from Airport to Hotel and to the airport for a nominal fee. This is the palce to stay in Madrid! You will LOVE it! Thanks for a great stay Best Western Atlantico! You guys do a great JOB!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I reviewed this hotel last year and returned again for a short break; no changes, the service makes everything so amazing. Yes, the hotel has darker rooms that won't suit visitors that spend a lot of time in their rooms - but I'm sure you can request a street facing view if that's your need. Besides, there are 2 lovely terraces on the 9th floor for tapas & drinks.
reviews.title: Location, location, location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I noticed in the hotel book this time that wi-fi is actually only available on certain floors (2, 4? from memory) - it does make a difference as last year I was on a non-wifi floor - but you can still use a cable.
reviews.title: Great Location To Explore Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think what makes this hotel so great apart from the service and the location is that given it's physical limitations, it's trying to be the very best it can be in every way - and after all, that's all any visitor can ask for isn't it?
reviews.title: Outstanding service from all hotel staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We just stayed 2 nights at the Atlantico and had a great experience. The staff was very helpful, and there was always someone at the front desk who spoke both Spanish and English. The room was very clean, and the bathroom was very modern. Though early in the season (April) the air conditioning worked very well. They have a wonderful rooftop area for drinks and snacks, great place to view the city.
reviews.title: Amazingly helpful staff and lovely hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I arrived in Madrid at Barajas Airport Terminal 1. We went to the information desk and asked where we could find the Hotel Atlantico’s shuttle bus. We found the bus, parked with no driver. The driver arrived as scheduled at 13:00/1:00 p.m. The free ride to the hotel took about 35 minutes.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: We spent 11 nights in room 705. Beautiful, clean, sunny room with a comfortable king size bed, and a balcony facing the Gran Via. The electronic shutters and balcony doors blocked all sunlight and just about all the noise from the Gran Via. The marble bathroom has two sinks and excellent water pressure.
reviews.title: Central, Elegant and Inexpensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful with a bar and lounges on the 9th floor. We enjoyed sitting on the roof top terrace. Even when it was cold at night we put on our coats and had a drink on the terrace.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — room size, the facilities and the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was delicious and worth the 9 euros per person. If you only have a pastry and coffee for breakfast, it might be considered too expensive.
reviews.title: Loved the service at the Atlantico!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Had read a great deal of good reports on this hotel and was not disappointed, rooms were spacious well appointed and clean, hotel staff courteous, knowledgeable and friendly. On a sunny day the roof top garden is a haven of peace away from the bustle of the city.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in central Madrid

likes.disliked: — 9th floor cafe bar not being open until 15.30.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a three star hotel the Atlantico certainly punches above it's weight. Location is great, 50 meters from nearest Metro station and 20 meters from city tour bus stop. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys the hustle and bustle of city life.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great value for the money
Great hotel in a perfect location
reviews.text: This is a 3 star hotel but is on the cusp of a 4 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: We asked for a quiet room and were given room 703. The enrtire 6th floor is being being renovated so it is noisy between 11:00 am and 8:00 pm. I complained about the noise and was given a room on the 8th floor(room 812). It appears that the 9th thru 7th floors have been renovated. Both 703 and 812 were above average in size with LARGE bathrooms. Both had double sinks. Both had bathrobes and slippers. Air conditioning in both rooms worked fine. Bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Outstanding Location!!!

likes.disliked: — The buffet was okay, but could have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located 50 yards from the Callo metro stop. The Sol metro stop is a 5 minute walk away. The Gran Via is the broadway of Spain. Very busy and crowded but a good location for a tourist. They have a shuttle to the airport that leaves every hour8, 9, 10). The charge is 6 euro per person
reviews.title: Great hotel for City break!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say that has not already been said? This is a great hotel with a great location and great staff. We took the complimentary shuttle from the airport and arrived at 9:30 a.m. after an over night flight from the US. We were in our room by 10:00 a.m. and out exploring in 30 minutes. Hotel location is terrific for walking to all major attractions of interest. The front desk staff were super helpful in answering questions and making reservations for shows and restaurants. The bar on the top floor was friendly and offered good sights. The breakfast room was spacious and offered a really nice breakfast. I would definitely stay here again and again and recommend it to anyone visiting Madrid. You can not go wrong.
reviews.title: Terrific Experience!
What a difference great staff make to trip
reviews.text: I stayed at the Atlantico from 22/04/10 until 26/04/10 with my wife and two friends. I used the hotel as my base for the Madrid Marathon. Upon arrival in Madrid one of our friends had her purse stolen on the metro. When we arrived at the hotel we were quite upset as this was not the best start to our break. The reception staff were outstanding, providing toll free numbers for all credit cards and helping with the police. The whole incident took about 10 minutes which was amazing. Within 10 minutes the staff had almost made us forget about the theft. Throughout our trip the staff were tremendous always trying to assist in anyway. The hotel was outstanding as well. The 9th floor bar is amazing and on our last night there was a concert on Gran Vie which we watched from the terrace, stunning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With the hotels great location you are within easy walking distance of all the main attractions.
reviews.title: Great location - lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel breakfast is great value and the hotel shuttle bus is recommended, as this would prevent tourists being targeted on the metro and its only 6 euro's.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: All in all after a terrible start to our trip the Hotel Atlantico and its staff turned our trip around. I now have a great impression of Madrid thanks to the staff.
reviews.title: Excellent location, new rooms very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff is friendly and perfectly fluent in English (which is definitly not common in Madrid!)
reviews.title: better than 3 stars

likes.disliked: — location - I was not crazy about the Gran Via (even though the noise did not trouble us)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: We stayed there for 4 nights last winter. Great location! Clean and nice room with fair price. But the drawback is their rude staff. They were mean and not helpful at all. We booked the hotel from expedia. The website said there is a travel agent onsite but this is not true. You need to go across the street to find it. But booking some packages to visit some nearby old towns really worths the money!
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel last week (single room £64 approx). I went to Madrid with a friend so we booked 2 single rooms. Very nice reception area, when we checked in she asked for a smoking room. We first when to leave her bags so we checked the room and it was HORRIBLEEEEEE. YUK YUK YUK. Tiny, smelly, with a view to a brick wall, single bed. awful!!! After that we checked mine and it was GORGEOUS, MASSIVE, GREAT BATHROOM, TV, INTERNET, MINI BAR, MASSIVE DOUBLE BED, ENORMOUS WINDOWS, ETC ETC ETC. I LOVED IT. (DO NOT ASK FOR A SMOKING ROOM)
reviews.title: Room 402 Is The Best ! Fantastic Location, Staff Not Very Friendly But Who Cares
Jewel of a Hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast is very basic but who eats that much in the morning anyway!!! the only downfall i think is the staff they are not NICE AT ALL specially in the breakfast area we asked for more coffee and the guy almost send us to hell. the reception people are a bit better but not so much.

reviews.title: Great Deal
reviews.text: I still think this hotel is great for the price you are paying because its VERY well located and if you don't smoke rooms are actually very nice and clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An outstanding hotel! The room we stayed in was outstanding king size bed, balcony and luxiourous bathroom mirrors on the ceiling. The hotel is perfectly located in the centre of Madrid. Hotel staff speak good english and nothing is too much trouble.
reviews.title: Probably the best hotel in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One minor criticism is that the bed had blankets and not a duvets but thats just my tastes I suppose.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic. There are many resturants and bars within 10 minutes walk along with sights like the Royal Palace and Place de Espana. The roof top terrace was a huge plus, having somewhere to sit and relax in the sun after a hard days sightseeing was great, you can even see the Royal Palace lit up at night. The rooms themselves were nothing to write home about but were clean and comfortable. The reception staff spoke good English and were always helpfull with any questions asked. I would have no hesitations about staying here again.
reviews.title: Great location with a great roof top terrace
Probably the best "Best Western"
reviews.text: This is probably the 'best' Best Western that we have stayed at - and we usually use BW for convenience. The room (7th floor fronting Gran Via) was excellent - beautifully decorated and very clean (photos). The reception staff and those in the breakfast room and 9th floor bar were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very conveniently situated on Gran Via, close to Sol, easy walking to the Royal Palace, the Prado and all the main sites & restaurants. The Airport shuttle is very convenient. We will certainly stay there again next time we stay in Madrid.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Atlantico is a standard 3 star hotel. The location is a mixed bag, although very central it is on the Spanish equivalent of Oxford Street and consequently could be a bit noisy. There was no view from my room and there was also quite a bit of noise from the corridors. Still overall, a pretty good experience, with a convenient airport bus service.
reviews.title: Solid hotel but a bit noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was an excellent choice for us. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was excellent. Location is great! The Gran Via location is very busy with lots people and traffic. With all the noise below, we heard nothing while we were in our room (we were on the 7th floor). The breakfast selection was very good. Cold cereals, fruits, cheeses with a small selection of hot breakfast (scrambled eggs and bacon). The service was impeccable. Staff at the front desk were very helpful in setting up our side trips and helping us with tips to get around the city. The rooms are VERY VERY clean. The cab ride from the airport cost about 30Euros and getting there via Metro is very time consuming with 2 seperate connections. The Metro (Gran Via) stop is only about 1 block away from the hotel, therefore getting around the city was extremely easy. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Excellent Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: As airline crewmembers we have had the good fortune to stay in many a fanstasic hotel and many no so great. Hotel Atlantico is Fantastic! The location is the best. Similar feel to Times Square in New York. Gran Via is also alot like Michigan Ave in Chicago. This particular location is right near the metro but you can really walk to everywhere you would want to see in the City. There are theaters across the street. A very nice Department store across the street with a Supermarcdo (supermarket) in the basement level. The hotel has charm and is super clean. The hallways are nicely decorated. We had room 811 (a standard room on the highest floor). The room was plenty spacious. Hardwood floors, Crown Molding, Hight ceilings. The decor was french country. White furnature, two nice size beds put together, flat panel T.V. The electronic shades made the room nice an dark and outside noise was not heard. As per other reviews the walls are rather thin and one could hear other guests or house keeping in other rooms in the morning. A suggestion is to bring a couple white noise sound machines which filter the noise and made the rest of our stay very comfortable. The bathroom was excellant. Spacious, Marble and Tile, dual shower heads. Could not ask for a more comfortable room. The staff was very pleasant and without a doubt I would stay at this hotel again. Five stars from me! Thank you Best Western Atlantico. You made are stay very pleasant!!!
reviews.title: Hotel with two faces

description: Emblematic stately building built in 1920, crowned by a tower with a French dome and located in the heart of Madrid. Soundproofed rooms provided with the most modern technology and an elegant decoration. The terraces "Gran Vía" and "Real" offer wonderful views over the city. It is just a few minutes away from the most important historical monuments and museums of Madrid, next to the shopping centre.
